fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \Sigma be a signature. The collection of (raw) terms over \Sigma is inductively generated by the following rules:

fr:ul.fr:li: Each variable x of sort A is a term of sort A.

Let us write t \colon A if t is a term of sort A. If f \colon A_{1}, \ldots ,A_{n} \to B is a function symbol and t_{1} \colon A_{1} , \ldots , t_{n} \colon A_{n} are terms of corresponding sorts, then f(t_{1}, \ldots ,t_{n}) \colon B.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A (first-order) signature \Sigma consists of the following data:

fr:ul.fr:li: A collection of function symbols, each comes with a prescribed type denoted as follows: f \colon A_{1}, \ldots ,A_{n} \to B where A_{1}, \ldots ,A_{n},B are sorts. Unary (n = 0) function symbols are also called constant symbols.

A collection of relation symbols, each comes with a prescribed type denoted as follows: R \rightarrowtail A_{1}, \ldots ,A_{n} where A_{1}, \ldots ,A_{n} are sorts. Unary (n = 0) relation symbols are usually called atomic propositions.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Each sort comes with a collection of variables. We assume that given any collection of variables of sort A, there is a variable of sort A not in the given collection.

Let \mathcal { C } be a category with sufficient structure and \Gamma = x_{1} \colon B_{1} , \ldots , x_{m} \colon B_{m} be a context over a signature \Sigma. Given a \Sigma-structure M in \mathcal { C }, the interpretation of a term-in-context \Gamma .t of sort B in M is a morphism { \mathopen {} \llbracket \Gamma .t \rrbracket \mathclose {}} _{ M } \colon M(B_{1}, \ldots ,B_{m}) \to MB defined recursively on the structure of t as follow:

fr:ul.fr:li: { \mathopen {} \llbracket \Gamma .x_{i} \rrbracket \mathclose {}} _{ M } is the i-th projection \pi _{i} \colon M(B_{1}, \ldots ,B_{m}) \to MB_{i}.

If f \colon A_{1}, \ldots ,A_{n} \to B is a function symbol and t_{1}, \ldots ,t_{n} are terms of appropriate sorts then { \mathopen {} \llbracket \Gamma .f(t_{1}, \ldots ,t_{n}) \rrbracket \mathclose {}} _{ M } is the composite M(B_{1}, \ldots ,B_{m}) \xrightarrow { ( { \mathopen {} \llbracket \Gamma .t_{1} \rrbracket \mathclose {}} _{ M } , \ldots , { \mathopen {} \llbracket \Gamma .t_{n} \rrbracket \mathclose {}} _{ M } ) } M(A_{1}, \ldots ,A_{n}) \xrightarrow { Mf } MB
